result.execSummary:
The defendant Bee Her was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sets Up Commercial Gambling Machine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 945.03(1m)(e).
  • Mistreatment of Animals/Cause Death [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/school.

Assessment, treatment and counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
Provide DNA sample and surcharge.
AMENDED: 3 days sentence credit added 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes:
Impose and stay 6 months jail for rule violations.
The 3 months conditional jail may be served with Huber if eligible.
Three months jail will continue at this time, parties will submit a stipulation with any jail credit.

Case Called: 8:45
Includes: 14CF162 and 14CF719
State appears by ADA Anita Lawrence for ADA Gramer.  Def appears in custody with Atty Michael Hughes.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to: 14CF162>>Count 1, Count 3, Count 4, Count 5, Count 6 and Count 7>>DRI
14CF719>>Count 1, Count 2, Count 3, Count 4, Count 6 and Count 7>>DRI
Court grants.
PLEA: 14CF162>>Count 2>>Sets up Commercial Gambling Machine/PTAC>>No Contest
Count 8>>Mistreatment of Animals/Cause Death/PTAC>>No Contest
14CF719>>Count 5>>Possession of Meth/PTAC>>No Contest
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: WS; Probation for 4 years (concurrent) with Conditions of: CC (including new surcharge), assessment, treatment and counseling deemed appropriate by agent, AODA, absolute sobriety, good faith effort to maintain FTE/School, 9 months MCJ with 6 months I&S for rule violations, (the 3 months conditional jail may be served with Huber if eligible) Provide DNA sample and surcharge. 3 months jail will continue at this time, parties will submit a stipulation with any jail credit.

$10,000 Sign Bond w/1st $2500 in cash
  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - Day Report.
  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
  No contact with victim(s): Animals or Gambling Machines or Poker Chips
Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
**No leaving Wisconsin without permission except for court appearance in Minnesota.
